statement:
Suppose $X,Y$ are topological space and let $Z\subseteq  Y$ be equipped
with the subspace topology. If $$f\colon X\to Z$$ is continuous, then
$$f\colon X\to Y$$ is continuous.

Let $U\subseteq Y$ be an open set. Then $$\begin{aligned}
  f^{-1}(U) &=& \{ x\in X : f(x) \in U\} \\
            &=& \{ x\in X : f(x) \in U\cap Z\} \\
            &=& f^{-1}(U\cap Z).\end{aligned}$$ Since $U\cap Z$ is open
in $Z$, $f^{-1}(U)$ is open in $X$.
names: continuity is preserved when codomain is extended
